poem:
**Flooding the Zone**

History wades through halls,  
pages soaked in centuries.  
Protests rise like tides  
around monuments of silence,  
whispering currents  
pulling truth to the surface.  
Museums become rivers,  
memory's deep stream  
overflows, while voices—  
timeless, unforgotten—  
drown out static echoes  
of erasure,  
reminding us to learn  
from the shape of every wave.
